Best Film:
''' No Country for Old Men '''
The '''16th Southeastern Film Critics Association Awards''', honouring the best in film for [[2007 in film|2007]], were given in December 2007. ==Top 10 Films== # ''[[No Country for Old Men (film)|No Country for Old Men]]'' # ''[[There Will Be Blood]]'' # ''[[Atonement (film)|Atonement]]'' # ''[[Juno (film)|Juno]]'' # ''[[Michael Clayton (film)|Michael Clayton]]'' # ''[[Zodiac (film)|Zodiac]]'' # ''[[The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford]]'' # ''[[Gone Baby Gone]]'' # ''[[The Diving Bell and the Butterfly (film)|Le scaphandre et le papillon (The Diving Bell and the Butterfly)]]'' # ''[[Into the Wild (film)|Into the Wild]]'' ==Winners== *Best Actor: **[[Daniel Day-Lewis]] - ''[[There Will Be Blood]]'' *Best Actress: **[[Julie Christie]] - ''[[Away from Her]]'' *Best Animated Feature: **''[[Ratatouille (film)|Ratatouille]]'' *Best Director: **[[Ethan Coen|Ethan]] and [[Joel Coen]] - ''[[No Country for Old Men (film)|No Country for Old Men]]'' *Best Documentary Feature: **''[[No End in Sight]]'' *Best Film: **''' ''[[No Country for Old Men (film)|No Country for Old Men]]'' ''' *Best Foreign Language Film: **''[[The Diving Bell and the Butterfly (film)|Le scaphandre et le papillon (The Diving Bell and the Butterfly)]]'', [[France]] *Best Screenplay - Adapted: **''[[No Country for Old Men (film)|No Country for Old Men]]'' *Best Screenplay - Original: **''[[Juno (film)|Juno]]'' - [[Diablo Cody]] *Best Supporting Actor: **[[Javier Bardem]] - ''[[No Country for Old Men (film)|No Country for Old Men]]'' *Best Supporting Actress: **[[Amy Ryan]] - ''[[Gone Baby Gone]]'' {{SEFCA Awards Chron}} [[Category:Southeastern Film Critics Association Awards|2000s]] [[Category:2007 film awards]]
